testproblem.name: water collapse exampleRuns a 2d, low resolution (for speed) simulation of the water collapse simulation performed by Zhou, Z. Q., Kat, J. O. De, & Buchner, B. 1999. A nonlinear 3-D approach to simulate green water dynamics on deck. In: Report No. 82000-NSH, vol. 7. (see also Park, I. R., Kim, K. S., Kim, J., & Van, S. H. 2009. A volume-of-fluid method for incompressible free surface flows. International Journal for Numerical Methods in Fluids.)

variables.variable: from fluidity_tools import stat_parser as stat finishtime= stat("water_collapse.stat")["ElapsedTime"]["value"][-1]
from fluidity_tools import stat_parser as stat mindivergence= max(abs(stat("water_collapse.stat")["Water"]["ControlVolumeDivergence"]["min"]))
from fluidity_tools import stat_parser as stat minvfrac= max(stat("water_collapse.stat")["Water"]["MaterialVolumeFraction"]["min"])
from fluidity_tools import stat_parser as stat maxdivergence= max(stat("water_collapse.stat")["Water"]["ControlVolumeDivergence"]["max"])
from fluidity_tools import stat_parser as stat maxvfrac = max(stat("water_collapse.stat")["Water"]["MaterialVolumeFraction"]["max"])
from fluidity_tools import stat_parser as stat vfracintstart= stat("water_collapse.stat")["Water"]["MaterialVolumeFraction"]["integral"][0]
from fluidity_tools import stat_parser as stat vfracintend= stat("water_collapse.stat")["Water"]["MaterialVolumeFraction"]["integral"][-1]
from fluidity_tools import stat_parser as stat nodesstart= stat("water_collapse.stat")["CoordinateMesh"]["nodes"][0]
from fluidity_tools import stat_parser as stat nodesend= stat("water_collapse.stat")["CoordinateMesh"]["nodes"][-1]

pass_tests.test: print 'divergence = ', max(maxdivergence, mindivergence) assert max(maxdivergence, mindivergence) < 1.E-5
